page.title: 06FARMING (2)
page.content: The growing of sugar beet, onions, celery, carrots and potatoes in this area means that there is a demand for the processing of them before going on to the wholesaler. This means that the use of lorries to move the produce is very important. Lorries carrying the sugar-beet to the processing factories at Wissington (Near Downham Market) and Bury St Edmunds are a common site, whilst the celery, carrots and onions are processed near Barway (just off the designated area). Potatoes are a very popular crop and lorries set off regularly for the big markets in London. Common sites in the area are th mounds of sugar-beet by the side of the road (mainly in Nov - Feb) awaiting collection and carrots, beet and onions lying on the roads having fallen off the lorries.
